item.title: Mirkats add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "To die would be an awfully big adventure." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Mirkats add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Mirkats add a quote by May Sarton
item.description: "We have to dare to be ourselves, however frightening or strange that self may prove to be." -- May Sarton

item.title: Mirkats add a quote by William Blake
item.description: "If a thing loves, it is infinite." -- William Blake

item.title: Mirkats add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Mirkats add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "We are all born mad. Some remain so." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Mirkats add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "The unexamined life is not worth living." -- Socrates

item.title: Mirkats add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The more I know of the world, the more I am convinced that I shall never see a man whom I can really love. I require so much!" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Mirkats add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Double, double, toil and trouble; Fire burn, and cauldron bubble!" -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Mirkats add a quote by Jane Goodall
item.description: "What you do makes a difference, and you have to decide what kind of difference you want to make." -- Jane Goodall

item.title: Mirkats add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I would always rather be happy than dignified." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Mirkats add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Men occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of them pick themselves up and hurry off as if nothing ever happened." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Mirkats add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "Three things in human life are important: the first is to be kind; the second is to be kind; and the third is to be kind." -- Henry James

item.title: Mirkats add a quote by Louise Erdrich
item.description: "We do know that no one gets wise enough to really understand the heart of another, though it is the task of our life to try." -- Louise Erdrich

item.title: Mirkats add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Mirkats add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Things need not have happened to be true. Tales and dreams are the shadow-truths that will endure when mere facts are dust and ashes, and forgot." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Mirkats add a quote by Betty Smith
item.description: "The world was hers for the reading." -- Betty Smith

item.title: Mirkats add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Listen to the mustn'ts, child. Listen to the don'ts. Listen to the shouldn'ts, the impossibles, the won'ts. Listen to the never haves, then listen close to me... Anything can happen, child. Anything can be." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Mirkats add a quote by Aaron Copland
item.description: "To stop the flow of music would be like the stopping of time itself, incredible and inconceivable." -- Aaron Copland

item.title: Mirkats add a quote by Henry Ward Beecherr
item.description: "Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?" -- Henry Ward Beecherr

item.title: Mirkats add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "Happiness is a warm puppy." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Mirkats add a quote by Jimi Hendrix
item.description: "I'm the one that's got to die when it's time for me to die, so let me live my life the way I want to." -- Jimi Hendrix

item.title: Mirkats add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "Kiss me, and you will see how important I am." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Mirkats add a quote by Jonathan Swift
item.description: "May you live every day of your life." -- Jonathan Swift

item.title: Mirkats add a quote by Shelby Foote
item.description: "A university is just a group of buildings gathered around a library." -- Shelby Foote

item.title: Mirkats add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Another belief of mine: that everyone else my age is an adult, whereas I am merely in disguise." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Mirkats add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I'm not afraid of death; I just don't want to be there when it happens." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Mirkats add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "The work of the eyes is done. Go now and do the heart-work on the images imprisoned within you." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Mirkats add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "Life changes in the instant. The ordinary instant." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Mirkats add a quote by Rudyard Kipling
item.description: "Words are, of course, the most powerful drug used by mankind." -- Rudyard Kipling
